Title: Transfers or disclosures not authorised by Union law

Content.Description: Any judgment of a court or tribunal and any decision of an administrative authority of a third country requiring a controller or processor to transfer or disclose personal data may only be recognised or enforceable in any manner if based on an international agreement.
Conditions: The international agreement must be in force between the requesting third country and the Union or a Member State.
The provision does not prejudice other grounds for transfer pursuant to this Chapter.
KeyPoints: Recognised or enforceable judgments and decisions must be based on an international agreement.
Mutual legal assistance treaties are included in the definition of such agreements.
